intro: Hetaeria rubicunda, commonly known as the red-flowered hetaeria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its striking red petals and lance-shaped leaves, which are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hetaeria rubicunda is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
